Pain in the knee

Headache

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
BC reported while the bus was stationary at the traffic junction of Choa Chu Kang Dr and Choa Chu Kang Ave 4 before BS: 44531 (opp Choa Chu Kang Stn) when one van had collided into the rear of the bus after the van was collided onto by a SG registered car.

At point of reporting the accident, BC mentioned there was no injury involved and BC was asked to move forwards to exchange particulars with 3rd party driver.

At 1650hrs, OCC spotted the 3rd party car was badly damaged and the 3rd party driver was injured. 

Police and Field Team activated,. Ambulance had since arrived at the scene.

At 1726hrs, MRC at the accident scene informed 3 persons were injured and was conveyed to the hospital. The 3rd party car driver, the 3rd party van driver and one pax in the van were injured and all 3 were conveyed to hospital in a conscious state. (Extend of injury and the whereabout the injured were conveyed yet to be ascertained)

At 1805hrs, police completed their initial investigation and the bus and BC were allowed leave the accident scene.

At 1813hrs, the bus was arranged off service to Choa Chu Kang Interchange.

For details of the 3rd party driver, please write to Mr. Pay Wen Kai for the required information.

BC was advised to report the accident to his Supervisor and Safety Depts.

Details of the injured party:
Car driver: A Malay male age 23yrs. Extend of injury unable to be ascertained and was conveyed conscious to KTPH.
Van driver: A Malay male age 48yrs. Complained pain on his back and was conveyed conscious to NTFGH.
Van pax: A Malay female age 45yrs. Extend of injury unable to be ascertained and was conveyed conscious to NTFGH.

No ambulance details was obtained.

VID: TP417K (SGT Hmril Aman)
VID: TP416M (SGT Lian Zi Yan)
Case number: J/20240307/0090Case Classification: MRA

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when opening / closing door
accident_description:
Pax feedback that BC have raised his voice and even confined him inside the bus when they have entered the Bus Interchange over a small incident. At BS44801, pax saw there was a mother with a young toddler who is running after the bus, out of goodwill, pax informed BC if he could wait for them to board the bus. BC asked him "are you going to board the bus, if yes, please board the bus". Pax was taken aback but boarded the bus.  Upon reaching BS45009, pax approached BC and kindly ask if there was anything wrong with what he did. BC raised his voice saying "what do you mean, please get down , im late for my dinner already". Pax wanted to alight seeing how BC stood up about to reprimand him even further but instead sat down back and closed the door on pax, unfortunately causing hurt on his arm, with his skin peeled off. Pax approached bus supervisor named Mervin and shared details with him. Pax also added that the BC walked past them and pointed to himself "im the person he's talking about". 

Incident Time : 1744hrs
Boarding point : Opp Blk 628 (44801)
Alighting point:  Bt Panjang Int (45009)
Interchange : BP
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Dear SMRT,

I would like to report an incident involving your driver of double decker Bus 176 on 6 April 2024 at 5:49pm for negligent driving.

I had boarded at Aft Hillview Station bus stop and alighted at Opp Hillbrooks bus stop.

I was descending the steps from the top deck to the lower deck to alight from the bus when said driver accelerated and braked suddenly.
This caused me to pitch forward, falling down the flight of steps. Two other passengers were kind enough to help me to my feet, at the bottom of the stairs. My right ankle was hurting and my lower left back was in pain. I had to hobble off the bus without any assistance. The driver offered no indication of regret for the injury he had caused.
Even when I had voiced out that he had slammed his brakes suddenly causing me to fall down the stairs.

I hope that this matter will be looked into seriously so that this incident won’t be repeated with other passengers, much less senior citizens.

Hope you can provide me an update on this issue.

BC reported while moving off from Bt Timah Road after BS: 40081 (Stevens Stn Exit 1), a Chinese female pax aged 72 fell onboard. 

BC then stopped the bus at next bus stop BS: 40091 (Bef Lewis Rd) to render assistance. The pax sustained injury on his right hand and back of the head. Ambulance and field team was activated.

15pax alighted when BC was reporting the incident to BOCC.

The ambulance arrived and after an initial assessment by the attending paramedic, the injured elderly female pax was conveyed conscious to TTSH.

BC was then arrange to continue with his revenue trip from BS: 40091 (bef Lewis Rd).

accident_description:

After exchanging particulars, BC was advised to transfer onboard pax and wait for the tow truck arrive. 


At 1947h, while transferring onboard pax, a Chinese female pax in her aged 51 years old complain knees pain to the BC. Ambulance and Field team was activated.


30 pax onboard transferred

After ambulance arrived, Police was activated by the paramedic. After initial assessment by the paramedic, the pax was conveyed conscious to NTFGH at 2015h.

After initial investigation by the police, the bus was released at 2115h, and was arranged to tow back to WTBP.

Damaged:
Bus: front windscreen cracked, right side glass panel shattered, front bumper damaged, and LHS view mirror arm bend

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when opening / closing door
accident_description:
The caller reported that the BC closed the bus door while the caller’s wife was still attempting to board, resulting in the door hitting her leg. 
When the caller inquired why the BC closed the door while passengers were still boarding, the BC responded that he could not see clearly. 
The caller expressed concern, stating that the wrong BC was hired, as the BC seemed unable to stay alert or see properly.
Furthermore, the BC did not offer any further assistance related to the incident, such as providing medical help. 
The caller is requesting compensation and mentioned he will be filing a claim. 
Additionally, the caller stated that he will write to us regarding this issue and plans to meet with an MP for further actions.

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
"I am writing with deep disappointment and concern regarding an unfortunate incident that occurred involving my child, my husband, and I on Sunday, 14 July 2024 at approximately 10:20 am.

 We flagged down bus 901. The bus captain saw us with the stroller with our 16-month-old baby in it and he opened the rear door for us to board. While my husband was pushing the stroller onto the bus, the rear door abruptly closed, trapping the stroller between the door panels. My husband and I shouted to alert the bus captain, who then reopened the door.

 The bus captain initially claimed that the door had closed automatically, but after further probing, he admitted his mistake and apologised. He drove on without checking if our child was hurt. Fortunately, our child was unharmed. I would think our baby would have been injured if her head or her hands happened to be sticking out of the stroller at that time!

 My husband and I are utterly shocked and angered by this incident, especially since it is not the first occurrence. A similar incident took place on 14 March 2024. It involved the same bus 901 (number plate 155Y). SMRT responded to our previous complaint (Ref: 2403-02963-01) with an apology and informed us that the bus captain involved would be disciplined. Given that this has happened again a few months later, we want to highlight the severity of the matter. We will not hesitate to notify the higher management and relevant authorities if it is not resolved appropriately.

 Due to the repetitive nature of these incidents, we will not be pacified with a mere apology. We seek monetary compensation for the psychological distress caused to our child, my husband, and myself. Having experienced two such incidents within a span of a few months, my husband and I have developed anxiety and fear of traveling on SMRT buses with our child in the stroller. Yet it is one of the essential modes of transport for us as we do not own a car.

 We urge you to address this matter with utmost seriousness and take immediate action to prevent any further incidents. Specifically, I suggest that SMRT review and enhance the training provided to bus captains, focusing on the safety of passengers boarding and alighting from buses, whether from the front or rear doors. Additionally, implementing stricter consequences for bus captains who demonstrate negligence in this area would encourage greater caution and mindfulness in ensuring passenger safety.

 We certainly do not wish to see another incident similar to the one which happened in August 2023 whereby an elderly women fell and fractured her spine when the bus rear door abruptly closed on her.

 Thank you for your attention to this critical matter.

 Note - I am not sure if the above fare card was the one I used that day. If it is not, kindly contact me and I can provide another card number.

CAN ID:1002230001751452
Incident time: 1020hrs
Boarding point:Opp Woodgrove Sec Sch (47539)
Alighting point:W'lands Sth Stn Exit 1 (46989)
Alighting time: 1032hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding an incident that occurred todayon 06 January 2025 involving one of your buses.

At 8:00 AM, my mother was on the way to work at the airport and boarded the Bus 110 from Bus Stop No: 67599, traveling on bus plate number SMB 1321C. Due to the bus being crowded, she had to remain standing. At approximately 8:10 AM, while heading towards the Bus Stop No: 65199, the bus driver abruptly engaged the emergency brake, causing my mother to fall.

My mother has a medical history of Prolapsed Disc, and the fall aggravated her condition. She immediately experienced pain in both her knees and back, resulting in significant pain. We had to seek medical attention at the hospital following this incident.

What is particularly upsetting is that the bus driver showed no initiative to assist my mother after the fall. He neither apologized nor showed any concern for her well-being. He displayed an unprofessional and dismissive attitude throughout the situation. His lack of care and accountability is deeply troubling, and reflecting poorly on the professionalism expected especially from a bus captain representing your company. His actions may jeopardise your company's reputation.

I request an immediate investigation into this matter, as this is not only a safety concern but also a failure of basic courtesy and responsibility. I expect a follow-up from SMRT Corporationregarding this issue and would like to know the actions being taken to address both the driver’s conduct and the broader safety measures in place to prevent such incidents in the future.

Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated.

Incident time: 0810hrs
Boarding point: Opp Blk 293D (67599)
Interchange : WDL

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I am writing to express my serious concern and dissatisfaction regarding a recent experience I had on one of your buses. On 9 Feb 24, I boarded bus no.172-Plate no: SMB105S and was about to drop off at Bus stop 44119 blk204 around 717am which the bus had already stopped at the bus stop for alight.

While I’m standing with my girl (Holding her hand) and waiting for the door to open and alight, the bus give a sudden jerk and I fell onto my back together with my girl.

Even when I was already holding tightly to the rails together with my girl but I’m not able to balance. At that moment, my girl fell and sat on the floor, I lost my balance and hit my buttocks against the steps.

After falling on the floor and hitting against the steps, I could immediately feel the pain directly over the coccyx and I quickly went to see the doctor to review my injury.

Throughout this incident, the bus driver did not show any reactions and it was as if nothing had happened.

I would urge you to take immediate action to address this issue and would appreciate it if you could inform me of the steps taken to rectify this situation and ensure the safety of passengers.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust that you will take appropriate action to uphold the safety standards of your company.

Incident Point: 44119 (Blk 204)
Incident Time: 0717hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to SSD and claims within 2 days

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I wish to feedback and report the incident that happened during my trip going to work. Last 25 Jan 2024, I board the bus service # 960 from Rochor station to Little India station. During this time it is heavy traffic along Rochor as the procession for Thaipusam is on the way. I noticed that the driver seems in haste to pass through along the bus lane.He keep pressing the horn. Suddenly the driver pressed the break resulting me to be thrown from the exit door (where I am standing) to near the driver's door. And another passenger falling on top of me. I feel dizzy after that I cannot get up immediately. The driver claimed someone pass cut through infront oh him that why he need to stop. The lady who fell on top of me, mentioned that need to report. The driver offered to bring me to the hospital, but I am still in dazed and told I am ok.I alight at Little India with the help of my colleague to board another bus going to our workplace.The whole morning left side of my body is aching. Comes afternoon that I felt feverish and left side of body felt my numb. i went to SGH AE to be examined. The incident sustained injuries in the right arm superficial scratch wounds that turns blue black and painful after few days, and contusion over left neck, left back and left chest. Though all the diagnostic test turns out not life threatening I believe my fall and that of elderly passenger can be prevented if the driver shown patience and not in hurry to drive.

Ezlink Card: 1000199001691253
Boarding Point: 07531 (Rochor Stn)
Boarding Time: 0847hrs
Alighting Point: 40011 (Little India Stn Exit A)
Alighting Time: 0852hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to SSD and claims within 2 days

would like to be compensated for her treatment.

At BS: 43171 (Blk 229), BC checked the passenger's condition and his grandmother insisted BC to continue service until interchange.

Upon arrival at the interchange, the boy and his grandmother approached BC and complained about the incident, added that the boy sustained bruises on his forehead. accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description: "I was sitting at the seat behind the driver. Bus 184 was making a sharp right turn from Clementi road to Clementi Ave 2. I fell off the seat. My chin knocked onto the armrest of the opposite seat and rested heavily on my bottom. For a few minutes, I couldn't move. My back was very painful and I was breathing heavily. Other commuters came to help me to a chair. The bus driver commented that I was sitting down and yet I could fall off. For your record, my phone was in my bag and I was not sleeping. I couldn't foresee the sharp turn. Moreover there wasn't any grab pole. My back is still hurting. I'm in my 50s. I alighted at 01.14pm I couldn't send my photo of the bruise on my chin as it exceeds your file attachment.

"""Feedback provider (road user) called in to request for bus plate number due to his recent incident with our bus service 110 on 20 Oct 2024 at 2309 hrs.
I have advised him to send in the footage via SNAP-REP.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Information provided by road user:
[09:35, 23/10/2024] +65 : Jareth here
[09:45, 23/10/2024] +65 : As per the footage. There was a hit and run incident involving one of your bus, bus number 110 turning up to TPE from Punggol.
Time stamp according to my footage is 11.09 PM on 20/10/2024
I will require the bus car plate number. Please assist. Thank you
[09:54, 23/10/2024] Snap Rep: Thank you for letting us know. We will look into it.

Incident time: 2309hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"" "

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Today, my father got injuried at Kampong Bahru (bus stop no. 10041).

Both my parent aboard the bus 61 at ~0820 hrs. from Blk 3 Everton Park (bus stop no.10021) and alighted at the next stop Kampong Bahru (bus stop no. 10041).

My mom who has chronic leg problem and require a walking stick whenever she go out. As the bus 61 stop a distance apart from the bus stop at 10041, she had to leap across from the bus to bus stop while my father support her.

As a result, my father lose his balance and fell on his backside in between on the road in between the gap from the bus and bus stop. While the inconsiderate bus 61 driver quickly close the door and drove off without coming down to understand what happened.

Luckily, there were others people waiting at the bus stop rush over to assist them. After checking there were no major pain they did not proceed to visit the hospital nor GP. However, we will monitor for the next few days as pain normal won't occurred immediately.

Unfortunately, my parent did not able to recall the bus plate number. From my parent description the bus driver is a Malay driver.

I am very sad that the inconsiderate Malay bus 61 driver. Did not response to the injuries party and drove off hurrily. I demand an apology from him for his negligence.

Please assist us olfor today bad experience. If there is a need to investigate who is the driver, we can provide the concession card. I really upset about the incident, as my father could be killed from the fall or crash by the next incoming vehicle.

CAN ID: 8000 2300 0166 8740
Incident time: 0820 hrs
Boarding point : Blk 3 (10021)
Boarding time: 0820hrs
Alighting point: Bef Kampong Bahru Ter (10041)
Alighting time:  0822hrs
Interchange : CCK
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

BC mentioned she had lodged a police report related to the incident

accident_description:
BC reported that an Indian Male Passenger in his 60s fell down from the seat in the handicap area of the bus while bus was stationary at the junction of Woodlands Avenue 9 and Woodlands Avenue 6 before BS:46471 (opp Blk 773). BC had approached the passenger to render assistance. Passenger was on the ground in the bus and was unable to get up. At 1040hrs. ambulance and field team activated. BC was advised to proceed to BS:46471 (opp Blk 773) and wait for ambulance.

At 1050hrs, ambulance arrived. Medic was unable to examine the passenger as he was uncooperative and was shouting at BC and medics. Police was activated by medic.

At 1102hrs, passenger boarded another bus and left the scene. Medics cancelled police activation. At 1105hrs, BC was arranged to resume service.

20 pax transferred

Unable to obtain pax  particulars as pax refused.

BC advised to report the incident to his supervisor and safety department.

Ambulance Details:
Activated: BOCC at 1040hrs
Arrived: 1048hrs
IO: SGT William
VID: QX1608M 432

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
"Incident Report Date of Incident: Wednesday, 19 March 2025 Time of Incident: Approximately 4:45 PM Location: Onboard Bus Service 960, [bus stop at blk 347] Reporting Party: Muhammad Alif Haffiz Bin Zainol Description of Incident: On 19 March, my mother, Azizah Bte Zainal, aged 61, had just completed her hemodialysis treatment at the National Kidney Foundation (NKF) at approximately 4:45 PM. She proceeded to Woodlands Bus Interchange and boarded Bus Service 960 to travel home. Upon reaching her designated bus stop at Blk 347, she pressed the bell to indicate her intention to alight. When the bus came to a stop, she prepared to exit. However, as she was about to step off the bus, it suddenly moved forward. Due to the sudden motion, she lost her balance and fell inside the bus. Two fellow commuters and the bus driver assisted her in getting up. At that moment, she declined an ambulance as she was still able to stand and walk, albeit slowly. However, over the next few hours, her condition deteriorated, and she began experiencing severe pain in her wrist and leg. Consequently, she was taken to the Woodlands Health Campus Accident  Emergency (AE) Department for medical evaluation. At the hospital, she underwent medical examinations, including X-rays, which revealed that she had sustained an ulnar fracture, along with knee contusion and swelling. Action Taken: • Two commuters and the bus driver assisted my mother after the fall. • She initially refused medical assistance at the scene but was later taken to the hospital due to worsening pain. • She underwent medical examinations at Woodlands Health Campus, where her injuries were diagnosed. (Please see files attached) Request for Follow-up: Given the circumstances, we would like to request a review of the incident, particularly the sudden movement of the bus while a passenger was in the process of alighting. Additionally, we seek any necessary action to ensure passenger safety and prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. We appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response. 
 
CAN ID: 8000230009097148
Incident time: 1633hrs
Boarding point: Woodlands Int (46009)
Boarding time: 1630hrs
Alighting point: Blk 347 (46549)
Alighting time: 1633hrs
Interchange : WITH
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: Failing to ensure passenger safety when moving off (harsh accelration)
accident_description:
On Wed, 26 Feb 2025 at 7:02 AM, Limin Eng <3.limineng@gmail.com> wrote:
To whom it may concern. 

I take bus 192 daily from 991 Upper Jurong Road at 0640hrs with my 3 years old son and 18 months daughter.

In carrying 3 bags ontop of 2 children.

I used to bring stroller along but i realised that bus driver doesn't even bother to help me .

I have to knock on the back door and struggle to move my stroller up the bus.

Nowsaday since no driver able to help.

I decided not to bring stroller but hand carry all my items.

I decided that bus driver are just selfish and drive fast because they want to complete their task.

This Morning. 26/02/25.

When i board the bus, the driver did not even bother to wait for us to sit down on the chair before moving off.

My 3 years old son fell on the steps.

He didn't even bother to stop the bus but continue to drive off fast before i manage to help my son to get up.

Is the passenger that helps me carry my son to the chair as im carrying my 18 months daughter!!!!!!!!

Throughout the journey, he drove so fast and just cut lane like nobody business.

Before reaching a traffic light he did not slow down the bus but hon at the front truck to ask him move as is green light.

This attitude is unacceptable.

Im fine if you refused to help.

But for my children safety, i expect a full reasonable answer from you all.

The bus is SBS 8355A

Incident time: 0640hrs
Boarding point: Blk 991B (22471)
Boarding time: 0640hrs
Alighting point: Blk 622 (22249)
Alighting time: 0646hrs
Interchange : BLI
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

BC claimed he did apply harsh brake to avoid collision with a private car that was travelling along AYE but BC was unaware of the pax fell. Pax alighted at HFI.

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when opening / closing door
accident_description:
Ms Li Yan called in 25 Mar 2024.
Caller's 80 years old mother-in-law wanting to alight at bus stop 11161. She said her mother-in-law was abit slow when alighting from the bus. The rear door was opened. one her leg was outside the bus and she was still holding on to the metal bar on the rear door. The bus started moving when the door still open. Due to this, her mother-in-law's left leg hit onto rear door. Her left leg sustained muscle pain. BC did not even came to check on her mother-in-law.
She already went to polyclinic for check up. Right now they they are monitoring on the condition. If turn worst, they might want to go to hospital for further check up. Caller did not want to claim on medical bill. But requested to know the outcome of this case as BC did not take care of the safety of the passenger. This was very dangerous. She requested for an explanation on this case.
 
I have rely the investigation to her. She accepted.
Investigation outcome:
Upon viewing cctv, indeed the Pax did not fully alighted yet and BC close the rear door without checking.  
Disciplinary action will be taken against BC.
 
Previously Ms Li Yan did not ask for claim as she thought that her mother-in-law will be alright after that. 
Today Ms Li Yan called in as her mother-in-law's condition was still bad.
Because her leg was very painful and weak. She has to quit her job.
Ms Li Yan plans to bring her mother-in-law for a full body scan and physiotherapy.
She requested SMRT can pay for that. 

CAN ID: 1800 2300 0187 7009
Incident time: 1500 hrs
Boarding point : Outram Pk Stn Exit 7 (06011)
Alighting point: C'wealth Stn Exit A/D (11161)

Interchange : BPITH
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Hi SMRT. I'm writing to you to bring awareness on my unpleasantness during my ride with Bus 903 yesterday. As usual, Bus 903 is always so crowded during the peak hours/season. My 5 yrs old son had a fall from the bus door entrance due to your driver negligence. While we were still making our way to squeeze through the crowd to the door, the door was about to close when my son already at the rear. Despite that, my child had a shocked and lost his balance and fell from the bus. Thanksfully, my son did not fell on his head. He suffered some scratches on his knee and bruises on the side of his face. This is a very unplesaant experience, and it was not my first time encountering such similar incident. Please tell me how can this be improved and such incident can be avoided? And how is SMRT going to be responsible on this incident?

Ezlink Card: 526471 ***0361
Boarding Point: 46009 (Woodlands Int B4)
Boarding Time: 1752hrs
Alighting Point: 46159 (Blk 206)
Alighting Time: 1803hrs
Interchange : WDL

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
"Date/Day of Incident : 30.5.2024/Thu

Time of Incident: circa 6pm

Vehicle Reg Nmbr: SG 5585J

Double deck service nmbr: 962

Place embarkation: Woodlands Bus Interchange

Place disembarkation: Sembawang Drive

Ez link card CAN: 1000 1800 557 9440

NATURE OF INCIDENT

Bus driver throughout journey kept braking, jerking every now  then.

My pair of spectacles was hooked to my shirt back then.

Suddenly when bus jerked again, my specs fell off onto the floor at upper deck.

I picked up  found scratch marks on my RIGHT len.

I hereby lodge an OFFICIAL COMPLAIN against your employee for his less than skilful driving hence resulting in the damage to my len.

Cost of replacing one len is $35.

Do contact me to discuss this matter.

NOTE: Scratched lens affect my eyesight.

Mr Teo

NB: Attached vehicle reg nmbr & my right len with scratches.
CAN ID: 1000 1800 1557 9440
Incident time: 1800 hrs
Boarding point : Woodlands Int (46009)
Boarding time: 1748hrs
Alighting point: Opp Blk 484A CP (58359)
Alighting time:1823hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when turning
accident_description:
"I wish to make a claim for personal injury for the amount of S$63.08.
Briefly, on 27 March 2025 at about 3.30pm I was travelling on service 950 from Singapore checkpoint to Woodland terminal.

Within the terminal compound, the bus took a sharp turn at a speed that I fell off the priority seat along with my helper.I suffered a cut on my right hand and my helper on her right cheek. Four passengers helped me to get up and guided me to the passenger lift. A few other passengers were telling the driver of the accident. The driver did not try to investigate or offer assistance.
The passengers who helped me asked me to make a report to the station office as one of them
noticed a blood stain on my white jacket.
On reaching home I cleaned the wound with antiseptic solution and applied iodine. All these time
I felt a tingling sensation and could not sleep well until I went to a clinic on 1 April, 2005 for
treatment of the swollen wound. I am now recovering well. 
I enclose copies of the injury, the medication list and the medical bill for S$63.08 your reference.
My helper do not need treatment.
I am 77 years old with diabetic condition, retired.

CAN ID: 8000230006499646
Incident time: 1447hrs
Boarding point: Board W'lands CP (46109)
Boarding time: 1431hrs
Alighting point: Woodlands Temp Int Alighting (47009)
Alighting time: 1447hrs
Interchange : WTBI

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Bus captain was speeding along Boon Keng and Upper Boon Keng Road. I was standing up with my umbrella as support as I am only taking the bus for two stops. He was speeding and I was flung off from where I stood and knocked against the bus. When I managed to balance myself, he continued to speed and I was thrown off again and hit my back against the hand rail at the handicap seat area. Please investigate why the driver was speeding/ rushing. His bus arrived at the 60119 Opp Boon Keng Station bus stop 13 mins before the stipulated time in the bus app, my intention was to take bus 31 at that point but 985 came ahead. My suspicion is he was hurriedly going to the interchange which is 3 stops from where I boarded. His driving is very dangerous and especially there's alot of elderly taking that bus from that area. 

This is a potential claims case.

Today it happened that the driver stops the bus too far away from the curb and I injured my foot while alighting the bus. I had to rest at the bus stops for sometime due to the immense pain before I can return home. Got once when the bus stops too far from the curb and one commuter on bus just open the ramp for me to use and I was yelled by the bus driver that I should not be using the ramp as the ramp is only for wheelchair not for stroller. I don't dare not open the ramp to use even when the driver stops the bus too far from the curb and this resulted to my injury. Please get back to me thank you

The rider fell towards right direction while his motorbike was flung left into bus pathway. Bc tried applying the brake but bus still came into contact with the motorbike. The motorcyclist sustained abrasion to his left leg and complained of pain to his neck. Police, ambulance and field team were activated. 

After assessment by paramedic, the motorcyclist was conveyed conscious to NTFGH. After police investigation, the bus was released at 1755h. The bus was arranged to return to KJD.

Bus damage : Front right bumper scratched

Pax transferred : 4

Officer: Sgt Afiq
Reg No: TP443J
Case ID: J/20240626/0095

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
"""Boarded the bus 187 from Opp Phoenix Stn bus stop at 12.45pm. As the bus moved off from Opp Bt Batok Driving Ctr bus stop, I moved to the alighting door area awaiting to alight at Opp Home Team NS bus stop. The Bus suddenly made a sharp 90-degree turn from Bukit Batok West Ave 5 to Bukit Batok West Ave 7, a Personal Mobility Aid (PMA) that was facing the opposite window, suddenly moved backwards and crashed towards the alighting door area where I was standing. The lady who was on the PMA, flew off and fell to the floor. I was stuck between the door and the immovable PMA. The bus then slowed down and drove at a slower pace while it was trying to reach the Opp Home Team NS bus stop. Some members of the public wanted to lift the lady up from the floor but many of them commented to let the bus driver handle the situation. Once the bus reached the bus stop, the bus driver walked towards the lady and helped her up. I was then managed to stand up and alight. After a few hours, I felt pain in my lower back area. Above was what happened. My feedback below. Please investigate why and how this incident happened and get back to me. 1. The PMA should be locked and not be parked where the user's back is opposite the alighting area. User's PMA should be facing either the alighting area or parked at least horizontally facing the passengers at the rear area. This will then prevent this incident from happening. 2. Why was there a sharp 90 degree turn out of no where? 3. I was stuck between the door and the immovable PMA but no one help me up. 4. I was shocked after this incident. I fell sick and took a 5 day MC.

CAN ID:1002 1900 0427 2495
Incident time: 1250hrs
Boarding point: Opp Phoenix Stn (44149)
Boarding time: 1245hrs
Alighting point: Opp HomeTeamNS (43641)
Alighting time: 1255hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"" "

accident_causes: Failing to keep a proper lookout
accident_description:
Hi, I would like to lodge a complaint on a bus captain who was driving recklessly along Woodlands Ave 1 on the time and date stipulated above. I am a driver of a car, and was stationary at a pick-up point along Woodlands Ave 1, at the Woodlands South MRT exit 2. There was a road construction in that area. The said bus captain had driven recklessly at high speed and had hit a construction barrier causing it to topple and propelled across the road, hitting the rear of my car. Unfortunately, I do not have a footage of the incident. However, I believe that all SMRT buses are equipped with a camera that could have captured the incident. I kindly request that you investigate this matter and take the appropriate steps to ensure that such behavior is addressed. I look forward to hearing from you regarding this issue and any actions and that will be taken, and also a compensation of the damages it has done to my vehicle. Thank you.
 

Called pax. Advise pax we acknowledge the feedback. Pax did not request for outcome. Pax request for claim regarding vehicle damage. Pax mention rear of the car was damage. Car plate number is SMF2483R

accident_causes: Failing to ensure elderly / pregnant / child / disabled passengers to be seated before moving off
accident_description:
On 26 June 2024 at about 12.30 pm I boarded SMRT bus 176, (Annex 1) near Block 183 Bukit Panjang Road. I was on my way to Winston Oh Hearing at West Coast for my hearing aid appointment.
As I was moving to the rear of the bus, the bus moved off and accelerated before I was seated. As a result, I lost my balance and fell and hit one of the parallel seats on my left and fractured three(3)of my left ribs.
One of the lady passenger managed to alert the bus driver. The driver came and assisted me and asked if I had any pain etc.
When I alighted at Jurong East, the driver said sorry to me and said he did not realise that I fell.
Feeling excruciating pain on the next day, 27th June 2024, I went to Bukit Panjang Polyclinic. The doctor confirmed that three (3) of my left ribs were fractured upon x-ray report(Annex 2). After that I went to Ng Teng Fong Hospital and was warded for 2 days.
Due to the above incident, I am claiming for special and general damages due to the negligence of the driver for not exercising reasonable skills and prudence. The partial photograph of the driver and bus registration number SG5140J, the date and approximate time is attached (Annex 1).
The following are my claims:-
a. Special Damages
1. Bukit Panjang Polyclinic Medical expenses ( Annex 3)      $ 24.592. Ng Teng Fong Hospital Medical expenses                $722.54
  (base on Interim Invoice) (Annex 4)
3.Transportation (Taxi, MRT and bus) expenses(estimate)     $ 20.00
4. Future medical and transport expenses
b. General Damages 5. Pain and Suffering – 3 left ribs fractured                 $30000
 (base on Singapore Academy of Law's Motor Accident
 Claim Online Quantum simulator for fractured ribs) (Annex 5)
 INTERIM CLAIM AMOUNT:                           $3,767.13
The above interim amount is not the final claim amount.
I will inform you of the final claim amount once I receive the Final Invoice from Ng Teng Fong Hospital as it might take several weeks.
I sincerely believe that the above claim amount is fair and reasonable for such a serious injury which I had sustained.
Kindly take steps to ensure that the CCTV footage in respect of this incident is preserved.
Kindly let me have your reply as soon as possible.
Thank you very much.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Caller reported that his wife was involved in an incident on Bus 502 heading towards Orchard. Below are the details of the incident:

Date/Time of Incident: Approximately 5:50 PM, near Holland Village, on 21 Nov.

Boarding Point: Block 289D.

Details of Incident:

The bus braked heavily three times during the journey. One major stop occurred around 6:20 PM, during which a passenger seated opposite the caller’s wife collided with her.
The passenger, described as a tall Chinese lady with a Chinese accent, wearing spectacles, hit the caller’s wife on her face with her shoulder. This caused damage to the wife’s spectacles, along with a cut and a red bump below her left eye.
The wife experienced pain due to the impact. The same passenger made contact with the wife a second time during another heavy brake, but the wife managed to shift to avoid further injury.
The wife obtained the passenger’s contact details, and the individual agreed to discuss compensation. However, when contacted at the agreed time of 10:00 PM, the caller and his wife tried multiple times over 30 minutes to reach her but received no response. The passenger also provided an address, which, upon verification, was found to be invalid. The caller and his wife believe the incident occurred due to negligence on the part of the Bus Captain and hope to pursue the matter further with SMRT.
 
Incident time: 1750hrs
CAN ID: 1002 2000 0204 6517
Boarding point: Opp Blk 288D (28631)
Boarding time: 1749hrs
Alighting point: Bencoolen Stn Exit B (08069)
Alighting time: 1839hrs
Interchange : SLD
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_description:
BC reported he involved in chain collision with a pickup and a lorry while the bus stationary at the traffic junction of Old Choa Chu Kang Rd and Sungei Tengah Rd after BS: 30091 (Chengtai Nursery) towards CCKI. Bus is the first involved with the pickup collided into the lorry resulted in the lorry collided into the rear of the bus.  

Field Team and Police were activated to the scene.
No injury reported and 20 pax transferred.

One Malay male PIW age in his 60s unable to be transferred due to unfavorable landing site for the wheelchair ramp to be lowered. Subsequently Police together with Field Team Staff carried the wheelchair with the PIW down from the bus and escorted the PIW to BS: 30081 (opp Hai Inn Sze) to transferred to another bus.

A Malay female pax age in her late 50s that related to the PIW had informed BC she suffered a shock when the accident occurred but did not sustained any injury. 

At 2210h, Police arrived the scene. BC was unable to obtain the pickup driver's details as the driver had fled. At 0120h after police initial investigation, the bus is allowed to leave the accident scene. 

The bus was arranged RTD back to KJD

Damages:
Bus: Rear portion damage (1st vehicle involved)
Lorry (YQ6083K) : Rear right portion damage & front portion damage (Hit our bus)
Pickup (GBF7733S) : Front left portion severe damage (hit the lorry)

BC was advised to report the accident to his Supervisor and Safety Depts.

For details of the 3rd party lorry driver, the Malay female pax and her NOK please write to Mr. Pay Wen Kai for the required information.

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when opening / closing door
accident_description:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding an incident that occurred on 19 Nov 2024 at 10:52am when I was boarding bus number 243W at Gek Poh Shop Ctr. During boarding, as I was bringing my market trolley onto the bus, the driver unexpectedly closed the door before my trolley had fully entered the bus. This resulted in the door crushing my trolley. Upon returning home, I discovered that one of the wheels had detached, with a part of it coming off and dropped either in the bus or on the road when I walked back home, rendering the wheel unusable and making the trolley no longer functional. This incident has caused me both inconvenience and financial loss. I kindly request your assistance in addressing this matter by ensuring bus drivers exercise more caution and providing compensation for the damage caused to my market trolley. I am willing to provide further details or evidence if needed. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response.
 
Incident time: 1052hrs
Boarding point: Gek Poh Shop Ctr (27389)
Alighting point: Blk 678D (22599)

Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I am wheelchair bound due to backbone injuries.

I was about to board the bus, the driver stopped with the rear door facing the stone bollard making it difficult for me to judge to align the wheelchair to move up the bus narrow ramp. The rear wheel of the wheelchair missed the ramp making it to topple backwards sending me off the wheelchair and hurting my back. All this happened while other passengers were watching. The driver who did not assist me from the beginning doesn't show any remorse and was unapologetic. Even when I dropped off the bus he did not apologise at all. 

Please advise the said driver accordingly as to avoid the same incident from happening again and which may cause serious injuries to other passengers who needs extra attention for a safe journey.

"[13:19, 23/02/2025] +60 : Hi
[13:20, 23/02/2025] +60 : I want to inform you about something that happened yesterday hit n run
[14:00, 23/02/2025] Snap Rep: We are sorry to hear about your experience. Please allow me to refer your feedback to a customer Relations Officer who will reach out to you.
[14:01, 23/02/2025] +60 : I called the police last night and needed insurance coverage for this incident, but the police told me to inform you.
[14:04, 23/02/2025] +60 : He bumped into me and walked away instead of stopping.
[14:06, 23/02/2025] +60 : If you don't want to take insurance, I'll go out and get it and tell you. If you want to take insurance, then take insurance.

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Date/Day of Incident : 30.5.2024/Thu

Time of Incident: circa 6pm

Vehicle Reg Nmbr: SG 5585J

Double deck service nmbr: 962

Place embarkation: Woodlands Bus Interchange

Place disembarkation: Sembawang Drive

Ez link card CAN: 1000 1800 557 9440

NATURE OF INCIDENT

Bus driver throughout journey kept braking, jerking every now  then.

Dear Sir/Madam,

 I hope this email finds you well. My name is Diana Yap, and I am writing to bring to your attention an extremely unsatisfactory experience I recently had with your transportation services. I believe it is crucial to address this matter promptly and seek resolution.

 On 28 May 2024, I utilized your bus transportation service for the journey back home. Unfortunately, the experience was far from satisfactory, and I feel compelled to share my concerns with you.

 I boarded bus 188 on 28 May Tuesday at 9.47pm from the bus stop at Bukit Batok HomeTeamNS. I alighted at the bus stop opposite Southview LRT and transferred to bus 300 at 9.58pm. I alighted at my house's bus stop Choa Chu Kang Avenue 3 at 10.02pm.

 My unsatisfactory experience was on the bus journey onboard bus 300 from 9.58pm-10.02pm. I was standing near the wheelchair seat area. I noticed the bus driver was driving too fast. The bus driver applied brakes suddenly at a traffic light near Sunshine Place to avoid a car stopping infront as it was red light. The sudden jerked caused me to lose my balance, and swayed from front to back. As a result I bumped back and hit my back. The driver did not check on the passengers and continued to move on after the traffic light turned green.

 This incident caused a significant impact on my health, causing my back to be swollen and lower waist pain, walking is very painful for me. As a regular user of your transportation services, I am disheartened by this experience and concerned about the overall quality of the service. I noticed bus drivers will drive faster at night. These drivers have a habit of dashing on the straights and jam brakes at approaching bus stops, and at times with standing passengers tripping, or seated passengers slamming against the back of the seats.

 I understand that bus drivers have a schedule to meet, and I respect the work and effort of these drivers. But I feel that passenger safety is of the utmost importance.

 I kindly request a thorough investigation into the matter and take the necessary steps to address these concerns promptly. I have attached my medical report for your reference. I am open to discussing this further over the phone at a time that is convenient for you. I can be contacted at 9678 9599.

 Thank you.

 Sincerely,
 Diana Yap

CAN ID: 1000230002003516
Incident time: 2158 hrs
Boarding point : Opp South View Stn (44459)
Boarding time: 2158hrs
Alighting point: Sunshine Pl (44689)
Alighting time:2202hrs
Interchange : CCK
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days

Received Whatsup :
Dear Ms Mesh, I have reported to you this morning with  regards to my incident in bus  service 110.
This happened on 6 /8/24 at about 8.50pm. My husband and I with few other passengers were about to alight at Anchorvale Blk 313 CP,  the bus suddenly stopped and my husband and I fell . There were a few others also lost their balance too. 1 man who was standing beside me told me this is already the 2nd or 3rd time.  I suffered bad bruise on my upper limp/hop and my husband had a long scratch slightly bled.
I am very angry as the driver failed to check on us, inspite being awared that someone fell.  He was driving very fast especially making turns and going over humps within the airport.
This behaviour cannot be condoned to prevent serious injuries to passengers on board.
I am looking forward to your investigation and soonest reply.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
The caller reported that she boarded the bus to the second deck because the lower deck was overcrowded.
She mentioned that she slipped while on the bus, injuring her leg and handbag. Initially, she thought the injury wasn’t serious and that she was fine.
However, once she arrived at her office, she started feeling significant pain.
She went to the hospital where she was given an injection and issued a medical certificate by the doctor.
The caller noted that the incident can be confirmed through the upper deck CCTV footage.
She mentioned that she almost fell backward but managed to grab onto the seats to prevent herself from falling. 
Unfortunately, while doing so, she twisted her back.
The caller also shared that she is 59 years old and cannot handle the pain well.
She questioned whether the bus conductor (BC) could see passengers through the CCTV, as the BC should wait for all passengers to be seated before continuing the journey.
The passenger provided her EZLink card number: 1000 2400 1086 2582.
She also mentioned that she intends to claim medical expenses and the cost of her Grab fare.
The caller still has the documents related to her treatment.
Lastly, she requested that the bus conductor be reminded to ensure the safety of all passengers before moving the bus and continuing the journey.

Incident time: 0705hrs
Boarding point: Blk 754 (45309)
Boarding time: 0701hrs
Alighting point: Aft Bt Panjang Stn (44031)
Alighting Time: 0721hrs
Interchange : BPITH

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
BC reported front right side of the portion of the bus was hit by the private car at aft BS:43991 (Opp BLK 635A) junction of Woodlands Rd and KJE exit when a private car abruptly cut into the right lane to left lane. 

20 pax onboard

Few pax had fell during the impact and BC unable to ascertain the number of pax fell and the extend of injury. 

Ambulance, police and field team activated.

The ambulance arrived and after an initial assessment by the attending paramedic, 3 onboard pax, a Filipinos and two Chinese female pax that sustained injury was conveyed conscious to Woodlands Health Campus Hospital. 

Injured pax:
-	Filipinos age in her 30s > No visible injury is observed. Complaint of pain on her neck.

-	Chinese female in her 40s > No visible injury is observed. Complaint of pain on right arm, right leg and right rib cage in pain

-	Chinese female in her 40s > No visible injury is observed. Complaint of pain on right shoulder and right knee pain.

BC had complaint of pain on his neck after being assaulted by a Chinese male pax that was onboard and had requested for medical attention. The ambulance arrived and after an initial assessment by the attending medic, BC declined to be conveyed to the hospital.

Police arrive and after an initial investigation by the attending police officer, all parties were released.

For details of the pax, please write to Mr. Pay Wen Kai for the required information.

BC was advised to report the accident to his Supervisor, Safety Depts and to make a police report related to the accident.

Ambulance details:
Activated: BOCC @ 1548h
VID: QX2145A (PA441D) & QX2305E (PA434)
Arrived: 1552h & 1556h
Attending medic: SGT Teng Yu
All the 3 injured female pax were conveyed conscious to Woodlands Health Campus Hospital via two ambulance.

Police details:
Activated: BOCC @ 1549h
Arrived: 1558h
Departure: 1700h
Attending officer: SGT Melvin (T190121)
IO Name: Rahim
AIO Contact number: NA
Case number: L/20240621/0080
Case classification: Major RTA

"Dear Sir/Ma'am, 

I was a passenger on bus 960 on March 19,2025. I and my husband took the bus at Stevens Stn Exit 1 some time around 10:45pm. The bus captain suddenly had sudden break and I hit my sternum on the metal where we tap cards as we were standing. I didn't go see a doctor right after because I was just fine even it was painful. Had a bit of bleeding on my lips though.

I observed a few days but it raised me a concern today since it's still painful when carrying things and having hiccups or a deep breathe and I decided to see a doctor.

Attached are the photo for the bus number, receipts and stand by X-ray request just in case the pain won't go away after 2 weeks.

Regards,
Rhodora Ramos

Interchange : WITH
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I was the first to board the bus. Once boarded the bus, I walked toward the rear door, wanting to sit on the seat facing the rear door. After me there were a few more passengers boarding. While the other passengers were walking towards the middle of the bus, the driver started to drive. Before I can sit down, the driver jammed brake and I fell down. A passenger was shouting and asking if I’m okay but the driver didn’t seem to notice and continued driving. I’m sure there is a SOP for SMRT drivers to make sure all passengers were properly seated or stand before driving out of the bus stop. Because of the fall, my left elbow, right elbow, right arm, right back and bone above right buttocks feel sore now. If the soreness persists, I will go and consult a doctor. Please see the CCTV on the bus and give me a reply on how you are going to address this.

Boarding Time: 1741hrs

accident_description:
BC reported while the bus was turning right from Bukit Timah Rd to Whitley Rd after BS: 40081 (Stevens Stn) when BC applied e brakes to avoid colliding into a Malaysia Registered private car that had travelled straight on a right turning lane.

BC braking action caused 3 pax onboard to sustained injury.

One Chinese female pax age 55yrs old complaint of pain and swollen on her left leg, a Malay female age 45yrs old complaint of pain and swollen on her left leg while a Filipinos female age in her 30s complaint of pain on her left hand.

No contact between the bus and the Malaysia registered private car.

Ambulance activated to the incident scene.

20pax onboard, all alighted as BC reported the incident to BOCC

The Filipinos female pax declined ambulance assistance and left the scene before the ambulance arrive. After paramedic arrived, police were activated by the paramedic. Field informed the Malay female pax both legs swollen. 

After initial assessment by the paramedic, the Chinese female pax and Malay female pax were conveyed conscious to TTSH. 

After police initial investigation, the bus was released at 0004h and was arranged to off service back to Woodlands Depot.

WeCare Card was provided to all the 3 pax that were injured

For details of the injured pax, please write to Mr. Pay wen Kai / Mr. James wee for the required information

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Hi, I would like to complain about the bus driver who drove 3588- bus 972 today, approximately 3.35 at opp west spring sec. When I board the bus at thong teck building with my 3yo son, the lower deck was full at capacity so we had to proceed up to sit. My hands were full and i was holding my son to go up the stairs. The bus driver did not bother to stop awhile for us to reach the upper deck and we had so much difficulties as he was driving at a fast speed. There is a camera which the bus driver can see from his view that my son was alreadys struggling. Nvm. We had to alight at senja road, So to avoid having difficulties to come down the lower deck, my son and I went down the bus at the junction when the traffic light turned red. Suddenly, the bus move and jam break, causing my son to tumble down the stairs from the top deck, causing bruise to his face and he is complaining of head pain. what is disturbing to me is that, the bus driver DID NOT BOTHER TO ASK HOW WAS HE and just drove off after I ran down and grab him up. My son was crying so badly in pain, it was the other commuters who helped us up.

Boarding Point: 09213 (Thong Teck Bldg)
Alighting Point: 44819 (Opp West Spring Sec Sch)
Incident Time: 1535hrs
Interchange : BPI
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to SSD and claims within 2 days

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when turning
accident_description:
"Caller was a road user who was driving near Hillion Mall.
As per caller, near to Hillion Mall car park on the left there is a yellow box and it's near to bus terminal entrance.
Caller did not notice the yellow box as it's near to Hillion Mall car park and caller did not expect bus terminal would be near to that area. 
Caller was stuck in a traffic queue with cars in front and behind her. 
Shortly after, Bus SVC 176 came from opposite direction and was on the opposite main road trying to turn into terminal.
As caller was stuck in the traffice queue and happened to be in the yellow box, BC of that Bus SVC 176 was honking non-stop at caller.
It did not took more than 3mins for caller to move out of the situation eventually when the cars in the queue she stuck in started moving.
Once caller managed to move forward a bit further from the yellow box which left a space just nice for Bus 176 to make the turn, BC made the turn at high speed and knocked into caller's car right back bumper.
Caller Mdm. Tan was left in shock and upset at the same time as she heard her vehicle was hit by the bus and BC did not come out to check at all. 
Mdm. Tan is furious about this as the hitting sound was quite loud hence she is sure that BC could've realized that too. 
Mdm. Tan requests an outcome of the investigation.

Incident time: 1935hrs
Interchange : BPITH
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I board the bus in front of Dhoby Ghaut Mrt. It was a double decker bus and I went upstairs to sit in front of the window. Before I could sit down, the bus jerked suddenly and I hit my left leg against the seat and twisted my knee. I cried out in pain but no one came to help. I sat down. I kept moving my foot and realised that I did not break my leg but it was still hurting. When I reached Segar Road, I decided to get off the bus as my left leg was in so much pain. I almost fell down a few times going down the staircase as there was no support from my swollen left leg. Two passengers downstairs asked me if I was alright and asked me to sit down but I couldn't. I asked a lady passenger to help me get off the bus as I needed to go the hospital. The bus driver saw me in pain but did not talk to me. I managed to take a picture of the bus when I alighted at 10.09pm but my hands were shaking and the bus licence number was not clear. Please check your cctv. I was wearing a yellow blouse and blue crop pants and sneakers. At the AE at NTF hospital, the doctor said I had a contusion on my knee and gave me 5 days m.c. with an appointment to see an orthopaedic surgeon on Wednesday December 11. I wish to make an insurance claim for my injury. Please let me know how I can go about it. Thank you. 
 
Incident time: 2120hrs
Boarding point: Dhoby Ghaut Stn (08057)
Interchange : BPITH
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: Failing to ensure elderly / pregnant / child / disabled passengers to be seated before moving off
accident_description:
My son too service 904 on the above-mentioned date and time. After boarding, the bus moved off. Then the bus brake suddenly, causing my son to lose balance and hit his wrist on the steps near the seats at the back. He felt discomfort and pain but thought it was a strain and went to work. He couldnt do much at work, so he decided to go to Polyclinic to checkon Friday. After the x-ray, he was given a referral letter to proceed to any AE for treatment. He went to Ng Teng Fong Hospital for cast. Would appreciate if SMRT can view this incident so that we can claim the medical bills incurred to us for this inconvenience caused. Thank you.

A 70-year-old pax boarded the bus and was walking to his seat when, just before sitting down, the BC drove off. 
The sudden movement caused the pax to lose his balance, and his leg got scratched near the seat, resulting in bleeding and the flesh came out.
The pax alighted at the third bus stop opposite McDonald's, as his intended stop was still far (Telok Blangah) and the bleeding was severe. He called an ambulance himself, as the bleeding would not stop. The police arrived to take a statement from the pax.
The ambulance transported him to NUH, where he received 12 stitches.

accident_causes: Failing to ensure passenger safety when slowing down (harsh braking)
accident_description:
I was travelling with my toddler in bus 242 in the evening. We boarded the bus from bus stop number 22359 and when we were nearing our bus stop, your bus driver applied emergency break for no reason after making a right turn from the traffic junction. My child was about to get up from his seat to prepare to alight when the driver applied the jam break and my child was thrown off from his seat and his face slammed against the black seat handle and he injured his lips and started bleeding profusely. My child was in a state of shock and cried non stop until we alighted at our stop. The bus driver did walk towards us but he didn't even offer to help my child who was bleeding. Please train your drivers to drive safely and to at least be considerate towards younger passengers who are in need of help. Very disappointed with the journey.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
"""On Saturday, October 12, 2024, my grandmother, Mdm Gowri, boarded bus 960 to Tekka from home around 8 AM. She transferred to bus 67 near Perumal Temple at approximately 8:40 to 9:00 AM. After several passengers alighted from bus 67, the bus captain reversed abruptly while the door was still open.
At that moment, Mdm Gowri, who had stood up from her seat, felt a sharp snapping sound in her knee.
She grabbed the seat handle for support as her umbrella fell to the floor and immediately experienced severe pain and numbness in her leg. Despite her pain, she managed to alight at the Perumal Temple bus stop with the help of a fellow passenger.
Once she alighted, she sat down but soon realized she could not use her injured leg. Struggling to move on one leg, she was assisted by temple visitors who performed basic medical checks and called an ambulance for her.

CAN ID:8000 2300 0126 8420

I had firmly held on to the grabpole when the bus suddenly had too much jerking and sudden Braking for no apparent reason. It was so painful that I had to sit a moment before continuing to go down the stairs in order to alight. Prior to that incident, the bus had also performed hard braking at the red light camera junction before opposite block 305 Bukit batok bus stop. I might seek medical consultation if the pain continues. Thank You.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I fell in Bus 190 (SH5745P) earlier this afternoon at about 12-55 pm. I had boarded the bus between Blk 13/14 Teck Whye Avenue. I had proceeded to take a seat when suddenly the bus jerked abruptly and I fell backwards flat hitting my head badly. Passengers on the bus helped me up. The bus driver came toward me and apologised. I was dazed and by that time my head had started throbbing and a swell the size of a golf ball appeared on the left side of my head. I also had abrasions on my left forearm and pain in my left backside. I felt unwell but I managed to see a doctor at the polyclinic nearby. He told me to monitor myself for any giddiness and severe headaches which I would then have to go to the hospital emergency. I am surprised that being a senior citizen, the driver did not wait for me to be seated before driving off. Please investigate into this incident and hope to receive a reply soon. Thank you.bruises on both hands. 

Incident time: 1255hrs
Boarding point: Bet Blks 13/14 (44271)
Alighting point: Opp CCK Polyclinic (44291)
Interchange : CCK
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

accident_causes: Failing to exercise care when opening / closing door
accident_description: "On September 6th, an incident occurred on bus 192 when the front door closed on a toddler boy's leg as he was boarding, causing injury. Despite multiple passengers waiting to board, the bus driver claimed he was focused on the rear door and didn't notice the child. His response was inadequate, simply saying oh sorry, didn't notice without checking on the child's condition. Furthermore, his driving skills are a concern, as he recklessly drove past the designated bus stop and stopped on the grass, inconveniencing passengers. Unfortunately, this isn't an isolated incident, as we've experienced his hazardous driving before. A photo taken on September 9th shows the toddler's leg with increased bruising and swelling.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I would like to file a formal complaint regarding the behavior of a bus driver on Bus 190, which I took on 06 Jan 2024 from BLK 157 to Stevens Station Exit 4. During my journey, I pressed the bell to indicate that I wanted to alight at my stop. Prior to reaching the stop, I stood up, walked along the aisle, and pressed the bell again to ensure my request was registered. I then proceeded to the lower deck to prepare to alight. However, when the bus arrived at my stop, it only paused briefly before the driver abruptly stepped on the accelerator, moving off from the stop. This sudden movement caused me to trip on the stairs, resulting in a fall that caused my left hip to crash against the handle. Realizing the bus had moved off, I immediately approached the driver to inform him that I had pressed the bell and needed to alight. Instead of addressing the situation professionally, the driver looked at me angrily and opened the back door without communicating this to me. I stood waiting at the front door, unaware the back door had been opened, until I noticed it myself. As I made my way to the back door to alight, I heard the driver hurling rude remarks in Chinese. This kind of behavior is entirely unacceptable and uncalled for. As a regular passenger on Bus 190 for this route, I have never encountered such an incident before. I am deeply upset by the driver’s lack of professionalism and courtesy, especially considering his role in providing public service. Furthermore, the fall caused by the sudden acceleration has aggravated a pre-existing injury to my left hip. I intend to file an insurance claim to address this injury and request that the company take responsibility for the incident. I strongly urge you to investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate disciplinary action against the driver. He must be reprimanded and trained on proper manners and professional conduct when dealing with passengers. Passengers should feel safe and respected during their journey, and this incident has severely undermined that trust. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and update me on the actions taken to address this issue. Thank you.
 
Incident time: 1410hrs
Boarding point: Blk 157(44279)
Alighting point: Bef Stevens Stn Exit 4(40239)
Interchange : CCK
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days"

There were 6 passengers onboard during the incident, no injury reported by BC.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
I am displeased with the behavior and conduct of the bus driver during a recent incident. On March 18th, 2024, around 9:20 am, Mdm Rose Yap boarded bus 178 at the bus stop opposite the Linear Upper Bukit Timah Road 44011, heading towards Woodlands Interchange. Upon boarding, Mdm Rose encountered difficulty to walk through the pathway due to another passenger standing in front of the exit door, engrossed in her phone despite ample available seating, Mdm Rose attempted to navigate past with her trolley. However, as she did so, the bus driver initiated sudden movement, causing Mdm Rose to trip over the obstructing passenger's foot and fall, resulting in a severe laceration to her upper lip, requiring 20 stitches, as well as contusions to her cheek and lower rib. Despite her injuries and profuse bleeding, the bus driver failed to stop and assist, continuing the journey.

Incident Point: 44011 (Opp The Linear)
Incident Time: 0920hrs
Interchange : WDL
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to SSD and claims within 2 days

accident_causes: Bc did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Ms Lee signaled to Bus Captain of Service 961 that she needed help with her stroller to board the bus at the rear door, but the Bus Captain still did not stop the bus near the kerb. The bus driver also did not assist her to bring the stroller onboard the bus, so she had to carry it up herself. 

As the stroller was heavy and the bus was not near the kerb, she lost her balance while trying to carry it up resulting in a fall that not only injured her but also caused the stroller to tip with the baby’s belongings falling out. When she informed the Bus Captain about this, all he said was that there are vehicles behind his bus, which is not a acceptable excuse for her.

Due to the pain she suffered, she went to Mount Elizabeth Novena's Accident and Emergency department to seek medical attention. She was admitted to Accident and Emergency around 1:30 PM because she fainted from the pain. She feedback that SMRT should ensure that all Bus Captains should drive next to the kerb, especially when there is a parent who is boarding with a stroller.

She wants to seek compensation for the physical and emotional trauma caused by this incident.

At 2024hrs, BC reported that the third party driver had alleged that the front portion of the van had hit onto the rear right body of the bus. BC maintains that there was no collision between the van and car.

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description: I took the bus after 22:33 p.m. on February 16. The bus encountered a traffic light on the way and needed to wait. After It was able to pass, the driver suddenly braked and caused my first injury. Then he suddenly stepped on the accelerator, which made me hit the punching machine, causing me seriously injured. At that time, I couldn't move and breathe. The next day, my back was swollen and I couldn't move. I had to go to the hospital for examination. I just took a stop, so I stood at the door of the bus and prepared to get off. The driver drove the vehicle dangerously, causing me injury and need to go to the hospital. The preliminary examination of my bones was not confirmed for the time being. It took two weeks to be checked again, and it affected my work. I need you to solve this problem.

accident_description:
Bus driver drove dangerously fast, and broke suddenly at the bus stop 320 resulting in my elderly mom falling back, landing on her elbow and behind. Passengers had already pressed the bell prior. Bus driver didn’t even check on her - surrounding passengers assisted my mom up to her feet and helped her. Some passengers around also commented that bus driver was riding too fast and rushing dangerously. Please check on CCTV from 3.52 to 3.55 pm where you can see how my mum fell. She injured her elbow and back. I can be contacted at 88994282 should you require verbal or further clarification.

CAN ID:8009 1900 0293 2370

Boarding point: Woodlands Int (46009)
Boarding time: 1552hrs
Alighting point: Blk 320 (46539)

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
Hi I would like to lodge a complaint about my ride with bus 199 on 24 Jan 2025, at around 8am. I used my Citibank cc to scan in. I alighted at NTU north spine admin building. 

I boarded the double decker bus from the bus stop opposite westwood secondary. Upon reaching the 2nd to top stair landing, the bus started to move. This is when I lost my balance and hurt my right foot. The pain was excruciating as I think I’ve twisted it somehow due to the sudden jerk of the bus. 

I have been to the clinic to seek treatment and was given a bandage and medication as well as MC for yesterday. (Written on 24 Jan).

Update: I just went to the clinic for a review, doctor shared that based on the xray I was diagnosed with undisplaced fracture and is required to go to the hospital.

I am seeking SMRT to look into this matter and give me a response.

Incident time: 0801hrs
Boarding point: Opp Westwood Sec Sch (27101)
Boarding time: 0801hrs
Alighting point: Boon Lay Int (22009)
Interchange : BLI
Interchange Mgr, pls get BC to report to claims within 2 days" collapse

accident_causes: BC did not cause the accident
accident_description:
BC reported that while traveling along Kim Seng Road before BS: 06129 (Grand Copthorne Hotel), a van suddenly cut across four lanes into the bus’s path and collided with the front right side of the bus. BC applied the brakes, causing six passengers to fall onboard. Ambulance, police, and field teams were activated.  

The field team arrived and reported the following injuries:  
- A Japanese female passenger in her 30s complained of head pain.  
- Another Japanese female passenger in her 40s complained of hip pain.  
- A Filipino female passenger in her 30s complained of head pain.  
- A 5-year-old Chinese boy, a 5-year-old Japanese boy, and a 3-year-old Japanese girl were uninjured.  

After assessment by paramedics, the two Japanese female passengers were conveyed conscious to SGH at 1830h.  

Following police investigation, the bus was released and towed back to Woodlands Temporary Bus Park at 1907h.  

Bus Damage: Right-side mirror dislodged and right front windscreen cracked.  
Van Damage: Left rear body scratched.  

Passengers Transferred: 4

BC reported while travelling along Choa Chu Kang Dr junction with Choa Chu Kang Loop before BS: 44541 (Northvale Condo) when BC applied e brakes to avoid colliding into a private car that had stopped abruptly.

BC braking action had caused a female foreigner an Israelis age in her 60s to sustain injury to her right pinkie finger.

BC called BOCC and requested for assistance. Ambulance and FT activated to location.

The ambulance arrived and after an initial assessment by the attending paramedic, the injured pax, an Israelis age in her 60s was conveyed conscious to NTFGH.

Injury: Right wrist, ring and pinkie fingers in pain

For details of the pax, please write to Mr. Pay Wen Kai for the required information

BC was advised to report the accident to his Supervisor and Safety Depts.

Ambulance details:
Activated; 1746h
Arrived: 1758h
Departures: 1816h
Attending paramedic: SGT Syakiraft
VID: QX2068D (PA442)
Conveyed conscious to NTFGH
